Detailed Description

Data class used to describe attributes of a file.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ FileInfo() [1/2]

IonicSecurity::SDK::FileInfo::FileInfo ( )

Initializes the object to be empty.

By default, the encrypted property is set to false, cipher family is set to UNKNOWN (see FileCipherFamily), and cipher version is set to empty string.

See also
FileCipherFamily

◆ FileInfo() [2/2]

IonicSecurity::SDK::FileInfo::FileInfo ( ISFileCryptoFileInfo &  fileInfo)

Initializes the underlying unmanaged object.

Parameters
[in]fileInfoUnmanaged ISFileCryptoFileInfo object.

Property Documentation

◆ CipherFamily

FileCipherFamily IonicSecurity::SDK::FileInfo::CipherFamily
getset

Determines the cipher family of the file.

If the FileInfo::Encrypted property is set to true, then this cipher family represents the family that the file is encrypted with. Otherwise, this cipher family represents the family that can be used to encrypt it.

See also
FileCipherFamily

◆ CipherVersion

String^ IonicSecurity::SDK::FileInfo::CipherVersion
getset

Determines the cipher version of the file.

If the FileInfo::Encrypted property is set to true, then this cipher version represents the version that the file is encrypted with. Otherwise, this cipher version represents the version that it is recommended to encrypt with.

◆ KeyId

String^ IonicSecurity::SDK::FileInfo::KeyId
getset

The key ID that was used to encrypt the file.

This field is only relevant if the encrypted property is set to true.

◆ Server

String^ IonicSecurity::SDK::FileInfo::Server
getset

The server that the key ID was issued from.

This field is only relevant if the encrypted property is set to true.
